com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapOffScreenRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapOffScreenRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OffScreenRenderer

    public final class MapOffScreenRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements OffScreenRenderer
    Map derivation of the OffScreenRenderer. This class as allows users to capture screenshots of a Map with or without the map rendered in an Android View.

    Here's a short example to capture a screenshot of a Map not rendered in a View: 

     
 OnMapRenderListener listener = new OnMapRenderListener() {
      // ...
      public void onPostDraw(boolean invalidated, long renderTime) {
          // map has been rendered, now it's OK to get screen capture!
          renderer.getScreenCapture(...);
      }
      // ...
 }

 Map map = new Map();
 MapOffScreenRenderer renderer = new MapOffScreenRenderer(ctx);
 renderer.setMap(map);
 renderer.setSize(500, 500);
 renderer.addRenderListener(listener);
 renderer.start();
 // ...
 // option to pause renderer, e.g. if UI is not visible anymore
 renderer.pause();
 // ...
 // option to resume renderer, e.g. if UI becomes visible
 renderer.resume();
 // ...
 renderer.stop();
 renderer.removeRenderListener(listener);
 renderer.setMap(null);

    • Method Detail

      • setMap

        public MapOffScreenRenderer setMap(Map map)
        Associate the Map with the OffScreen renderer.

        Make sure to set the map back to null after calling MapOffScreenRenderer.stop() to free up resources properly.

        Parameters:
        map - Map instance to render in the offscreen renderer.
        Returns:
        This MapOffScreenRenderer object

      • addOnMapRenderListener

        public void addOnMapRenderListener(OnMapRenderListener listener)
        Adds a OnMapRenderListener to listen for map render events. This method is only effective after a Map has been associated with the renderer by calling MapOffScreenRenderer.setMap(Map).
        Parameters:
        listener - A OnMapRenderListener to add to the MapOffScreenRenderer
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.removeOnMapRenderListener(OnMapRenderListener)

      • removeOnMapRenderListener

        public void removeOnMapRenderListener(OnMapRenderListener listener)
        Removes an existing OnMapRenderListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - A OnMapRenderListener to remove from the MapOffScreenRenderer

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the offscreen renderer. A new PBuffer based surface will be allocated.
        Before calling this method, MapOffScreenRenderer.setSize(int, int) must have been called with valid values.
        Specified by:
        start in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if MapOffScreenRenderer is already started.
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.pause(), MapOffScreenRenderer.stop()

      • start

        public void start(android.view.SurfaceHolder renderTarget,
                  OffScreenRenderer.SurfaceUpdatedListener listener)
        Start the offscreen renderer. The renderer will be attached to the supplied SurfaceHolder argument.
        Specified by:
        start in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Parameters:
        renderTarget - Surface to attach to.
        listener - Callback when the surface has been updated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if MapOffScreenRenderer is already started.
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.pause(), MapOffScreenRenderer.stop()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the offscreen renderer. All resource allocated will be released. Use this method if renderer is not needed anymore, otherwise use MapOffScreenRenderer.pause().
        Specified by:
        stop in interface OffScreenRenderer
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.pause(), MapOffScreenRenderer.resume()

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause currently running offscreen renderer. Use this method if renderer needs to be paused for some time. Allocated resources will not be released. To resume renderer call MapOffScreenRenderer.resume(). Only started renderer can be paused.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this MapOffScreenRenderer is not started.
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.resume(), MapOffScreenRenderer.stop()

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume currently paused offscreen renderer. Only paused renderer can be resumed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this MapOffScreenRenderer is not in pause state.
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.pause()

      • setSize

        public MapOffScreenRenderer setSize(int width,
                                    int height)
        Set the size of the requested screen surface. This method must be called before MapOffScreenRenderer.start().
        Specified by:
        setSize in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Parameters:
        width - The screen surface width, in number of pixels
        height - The screen surface height, in number of pixels
        Returns:
        This MapOffScreenRenderer object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or length is less than or equal to 0

      • getScreenCapture

        public void getScreenCapture(OnScreenCaptureListener listener)
        Returns the full screen bitmap for the Map. This method is asynchronous and will invoke a callback once the operation is completed through the OnScreenCaptureListener.

        The MapOffScreenRenderer must have been started and the Map rendered in order to create the screen capture. For Map being rendered in a View, users can use the methods Map.getHeight() or Map.getWidth() to verify that the Map has been rendered. Otherwise, users can also utilize the OnMapRenderListener.onPostDraw(boolean, long) callback to confirm when the Map has been rendered.

        Note that this requires the device to support EGL pBuffer Surfaces. It is recommended to have a size of a power of two. (For example 128x128, 256x256).

        Specified by:
        getScreenCapture in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Parameters:
        listener - A OnScreenCaptureListener to listen for the callback when screen capture is complete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null.
        See Also:
        MapOffScreenRenderer.start(), OffScreenRenderer.start(SurfaceHolder, SurfaceUpdatedListener), OnMapRenderListener.onPostDraw(boolean, long)

      • setViewRect

        public MapOffScreenRenderer setViewRect(ViewRect viewRect)
        Set the view rectangle where the map will be drawn. This API can only called after the MapOffScreenRenderer.setMap(Map) with a valid Map has been called.
        Parameters:
        viewRect - Rectangle where the map will be drawn to the view.
        Returns:
        This MapOffScreenRenderer object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if a map has not been set to the MapOffScreenRenderer.

      • setBlockingRendering

        public MapOffScreenRenderer setBlockingRendering(boolean blocking)
        Toggle if the offscreen renderer draws synchronously. This means it will block waiting for all required data to complete rendering.

        This API only takes effect after MapOffScreenRenderer.setMap(Map) has been called.

        It is also recommended animations be disabled with the method Map.setFadingAnimations(boolean).

        Parameters:
        blocking - true if rendering will block, false otherwise. Default is false.
        Returns:
        This MapOffScreenRenderer object

      • getBlockingRendering

        public boolean getBlockingRendering()
        Get whether the offscreen renderer is rendering synchronously.

        This API only takes effect after MapOffScreenRenderer.setMap(Map) has been called. By default, blocking rendering is disabled.

        Returns:
        true if rendering synchronously, false otherwise.
